poem:
"Betrayer of Promises"

The oil, the gas,
Yesterday's promise now 
a tattered sermon. 
Commons, chatter, a 
bill–
no warmth for hearth,
no jobs from old bones. 

The North Sea whispers 
in the morning mist,
its laments drowned 
by wounded machinery. 
Renew! Renew!
pleads the crumpled 
promise, echoing– 
A waged war, 
where man betrays 
the marrow of the earth.
